Inquiries_English: How can you verify if the recruitment agency is legitimate?
Sub_Topic_Question: Paano malalaman kung legit ang recruitment agency?
Established_Response:
To verify if a recruitment agency is legitimate, please visit the Department of Migrant Workers website  https://dmw.gov.ph/licensed-recruitment-agencies and search for licensed recruitment agencies. You can also check their approved job orders and contact them through their official channels for further verification.  Here, you can check the status of the recruitment agency, whether it is licensed, suspended, permanently banned, or closed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 Beware of illegal recruiters! Here are the signs of an illegal recruiter:

Not Registered with POEA: Always check the recruitment agency's status on the POEA website to see if they are licensed, suspended, permanently banned, or closed.
Immediate Request for Placement Fee Without Receipt: Legitimate agencies will always provide an official receipt for any payments.
Medical Exam Without Clear Employer: Ensure you know the specific employer before undergoing any medical exams.
Lack of Job Details: Be cautious if the recruiter is secretive about the job details.
Tourist Visa Instead of Working Visa: Applying for a tourist visa with the intent to work is illegal and unsafe.
Promises of Quick Departure: Legitimate job processes take time, so be wary of promises for quick departures.
No Valid ID: Always ask for valid identification from the recruiter.
No Employment Contract: A reputable job offer always includes a contract.
No Office: Insist on meeting at the agency’s office, not in informal places.
Showcases Success Stories: Be skeptical of success claims without verifiable proof.
Established_Response_Tagalog:
Upang mapatunayan kung ang isang ahensya ng pangangalap ay lehitimo, mangyaring bisitahin ang website ng Kagawaran ng Migrant Workers https://dmw.gov.ph/licensed-recruitment-agencies at paghahanap para sa mga lisensyadong ahensya ng recruitment.Maaari mo ring suriin ang kanilang naaprubahang mga order ng trabaho at makipag -ugnay sa kanila sa pamamagitan ng kanilang mga opisyal na channel para sa karagdagang pag -verify.Dito, maaari mong suriin ang katayuan ng ahensya ng recruitment, kung ito ay lisensyado, suspindihin, permanenteng ipinagbawal, o sarado.

Mag -ingat sa mga iligal na recruiter!Narito ang mga palatandaan ng isang iligal na recruiter:

Kakulangan ng mga detalye ng trabaho: Maging maingat kung ang recruiter ay lihim tungkol sa mga detalye ng trabaho.
Ang visa ng turista sa halip na nagtatrabaho visa: ang pag -aaplay para sa isang visa ng turista na may hangarin na magtrabaho ay ilegal at hindi ligtas.
Mga Pangako ng Mabilis na Pag -alis: Ang mga lehitimong proseso ng trabaho ay tumatagal ng oras, kaya't maging maingat sa mga pangako para sa mabilis na pag -alis.

Inquiries_English: What is PESO?
Sub_Topic_Question: Ano ang PESO?
Established_Response:
The Public Employment Service Office (PESO) is a non-fee charging multi-employment service facility or entity established or accredited pursuant to Republic Act No. 8759, otherwise known as the PESO Act of 1999. The Act provides that in order to carry out full employment and equality of employment opportunities for all, and to strengthen and expand the existing employment facilitation service machinery of the government particularly at the local levels, there shall be established in all capital towns of provinces, key cities, and other strategic areas a Public Employment Service Office.

The PESO's are community-based and maintained largely by local government units (LGU's) and a number of non-governmental organizations (NGO's) or community-based organizations (CBO's) and state universities and colleges (SUC's). The PESO's are linked to the regional offices of the Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) for coordination and technical supervision, and to the DOLE central office, to constitute the national employment service network.                                                                                                                                               Services of PESO for OFWs or Migrant Workers:

Job Fairs: Connects job seekers with employers for immediate job matching.
Reintegration Assistance: Helps returning Filipino migrant workers reintegrate into society.
Employment Counseling: Provides career guidance, pre-employment counseling, and orientation.
Livelihood Programs: Offers information on livelihood and self-employment opportunities.
Special Credit Assistance: Enables qualified applicants to avail opportunities for overseas employment.  (https://peis.philjobnet.ph/peso.aspx)

Ang Public Employment Service Office (PESO) ay isang hindi bayad na pagsingil ng Multi-Employment Service Facility o Entity na itinatag o akreditado alinsunod sa Republic Act No. 8759, kung hindi man kilala bilang Peso Act of 1999. Ang Batas ay nagbibigay na upang maisagawaBuong trabaho at pagkakapantay -pantay ng mga oportunidad sa pagtatrabaho para sa lahat, at upang palakasin at mapalawak ang umiiral na makinarya ng serbisyo ng pagpapadali ng trabaho lalo na sa mga lokal na antas, dapat na maitatag sa lahat ng mga kabisera ng bayan ng mga lalawigan, pangunahing mga lungsod, at iba pang mga madiskarteng lugar ng isang publikoOpisina ng Serbisyo sa Trabaho.

Ang PESO ay batay sa pamayanan at pinananatili ng mga lokal na yunit ng gobyerno (LGU) at isang bilang ng mga non-government organization (NGO's) o mga organisasyong nakabase sa komunidad (CBO's) at mga unibersidad ng estado at kolehiyo (SUC's).Ang PESO's ay naka -link sa mga tanggapan ng rehiyon ng Department of Labor and Employment (DOLE) para sa koordinasyon at teknikal na pangangasiwa, at sa Dole Central Office, upang maging bumubuo ng National Employment Service Network.Mga Serbisyo ng Peso para sa OFWS o Migrant Workers:

Job Fairs: Nag -uugnay sa mga naghahanap ng trabaho sa mga employer para sa agarang pagtutugma sa trabaho.
Tulong sa Reintegration: Tumutulong sa pagbabalik ng mga manggagawa sa migranteng Pilipino na muling nag -iisa sa lipunan.
Pagpapayo sa Trabaho: Nagbibigay ng gabay sa karera, pagpapayo sa pre-employment, at oryentasyon.
Mga Programa sa Kabuhayan: Nag-aalok ng impormasyon tungkol sa mga pagkakataon sa kabuhayan at pagtatrabaho sa sarili.

Inquiries_English: Is it possible to return after the contract ends?
Sub_Topic_Question: Pwede ba bumalik kapag natapos ang kontrata?
Established_Response: Yes, OFWs (Overseas Filipino Workers) can work again even if their contract is finished. They can renew their contracts with the same employer or find new employment opportunities either in the same country or in another. It's essential to ensure that all necessary legal and administrative procedures are followed, including securing the appropriate work permits and visas. For assistance and more information, OFWs can contact the Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) or visit their website for job prospects.

Inquiries_English: What is iqama?
Sub_Topic_Question: Ano ang iqama?
Established_Response: An Iqama is a residence permit issued to foreign nationals in Saudi Arabia, allowing them to live and work in the country. It serves as an official identification card and contains essential details such as the holder's name, nationality, job title, employer, and Iqama number. The Iqama must be carried at all times and is typically renewed annually.

Inquiries_English: What is PAOS
Sub_Topic_Question: Ano ang PAOS?
Established_Response: The PAOS, or Post Arrival Orientation Seminar, is an orientation seminar that an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) undergoes upon arrival in the host country. The employer must also attend the seminar. Additionally, a representative from the Foreign Recruitment Agency (FRA) or the Migrant Workers Office (MWO) and the Philippine Embassy must be present. They will explain the rights and obligations of both the worker and the employer according to the contract and the labor laws of the host country.
Established_Response_Tagalog: Ang PAOS, o pag -post ng orientation orientation seminar, ay isang orientation seminar na ang isang OFW (sa ibang bansa na manggagawa sa Pilipino) ay sumailalim sa pagdating sa host country.Dapat ding dumalo ang employer sa seminar.Bilang karagdagan, ang isang kinatawan mula sa Foreign Recruitment Agency (FRA) o ang Migrant Workers Office (MWO) at ang Embahada ng Pilipinas ay dapat na naroroon.Ipapaliwanag nila ang mga karapatan at obligasyon ng kapwa manggagawa at employer ayon sa kontrata at mga batas sa paggawa ng host bansa.

Inquiries_English: I am being abused by my employer, where can I ask for help?
Sub_Topic_Question: Inaabuso po ako ng amo ko, saan po pwedeng humingi ng tulong?
Established_Response:
If you are being abused by your employer or recruitment agency, please report it to the nearest Migrant Workers Office (MWO) or Philippine Overseas Labor Office (POLO). You can text or call them. Find the nearest MWO/POLO and their contact details in this directory - https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/DIRECTORY-OF-OVERSEAS-POSTS-For-Dissemination.pdf
If you need further assistance, please wait for a CMA caseworker to assist you. In the meantime, instruct your family members in the Philippines to report your concern. They can contact the hotline at 1348 or email repat@dmw.gov.ph.
To report to your OWWA regional welfare office, click this https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/RWOs-Directory-as-of-08262022-2.pdf                                                                                          In cases where the employer violates the worker's rights, including issues of abuse, the law  (Migrant Workers Act of 1995 or RA 8042 stipulates that the employer and the recruitment agency are jointly liable for all claims and damages, ensuring that the worker has avenues for seeking redress and compensation.

Stay strong and know that help is on the way. You've taken an important step by reporting the abuse. Find a safe place to wait and focus on your breathing. You're not alone, and a caseworker will assist you soon.
Established_Response_Tagalog:
Kung inaabuso ka ng iyong employer o ahensya ng recruitment, mangyaring iulat ito sa pinakamalapit na Migrant Workers Office (MWO) o Philippine Overseas Labor Office (POLO).Maaari kang mag -text o tawagan ang mga ito.Hanapin ang pinakamalapit na MWO/POLO at ang kanilang mga detalye ng contact sa direktoryo na ito-https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/directory-of-overseas-posts-for-dissemination.pdf
Kung kailangan mo ng karagdagang tulong, mangyaring maghintay para sa isang CMA caseworker na tulungan ka.Samantala, turuan ang mga miyembro ng iyong pamilya sa Pilipinas na iulat ang iyong pag -aalala.Maaari silang makipag -ugnay sa hotline sa 1348 o mag -email sa repat@dmw.gov.ph.
Upang mag-ulat sa iyong Owwa Regional Welfare Office, i-click ang https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/rwos-directory-as-of-08262022-2.pdf sa mga kaso kung saan lumalabag ang employerAng mga karapatan ng manggagawa, kabilang ang mga isyu ng pang -aabuso, ang batas (Migrant Workers Act of 1995 o RA 8042 ay nagtatakda na ang employer at ahensya ng recruitment ay magkakasamang mananagot para sa lahat ng mga pag -angkin at pinsala, tinitiyak na ang manggagawa ay may mga paraan para sa paghanap ng redress at kabayaran.

Manatiling malakas at alamin na ang tulong ay nasa daan.Gumawa ka ng isang mahalagang hakbang sa pamamagitan ng pag -uulat ng pang -aabuso.Maghanap ng isang ligtas na lugar upang maghintay at tumuon sa iyong paghinga.Hindi ka nag -iisa, at tutulungan ka ng isang caseworker sa lalong madaling panahon.

Inquiries_English: Where can I report if my employer is not giving me my salary?
Sub_Topic_Question: Saan pwede magreport kung hindi binibigay ng amo ko ang sahod ko?
Established_Response:
First, ensure you have a record of your unpaid salary and your employment contract. Next, report it to your recruitment agency. If your recruitment agency does not assist you, report it to the nearest Migrant Workers Office (MWO) or Philippine Overseas Labor Office (POLO). You can text or call them. Find the nearest MWO and their contact details in the directory - https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/DIRECTORY-OF-OVERSEAS-POSTS-For-Dissemination.pdf

The MWO ensures the protection of the rights and promotes the welfare and interests of overseas Filipino migrant workers, assisting with all employer-employee relationship issues.                                                                                                                                                                                                          REMEMBER: According to the POEA Standard Employment Contract for Filipino Household Service Workers (HSWs) Bound for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (2013):

“The employer shall open a bank account for the HSW in KSA, subject to SAMA rules and regulations, and shall deposit regularly every end of the month the salary of the HSW into the said account. The passbook or deposit slip, or their equivalent, shall be given to the HSW and remain in his/her custody. The employer shall help the HSW to remit his/her salary through proper banking channels.”
Established_Response_Tagalog:
Una, tiyakin na mayroon kang isang talaan ng iyong hindi bayad na suweldo at ang iyong kontrata sa pagtatrabaho.Susunod, iulat ito sa iyong ahensya ng pangangalap.Kung ang iyong ahensya ng pangangalap ay hindi makakatulong sa iyo, iulat ito sa pinakamalapit na Migrant Workers Office (MWO) o Philippine Overseas Labor Office (POLO).Maaari kang mag -text o tawagan ang mga ito.Hanapin ang pinakamalapit na MWO at ang kanilang mga detalye ng contact sa direktoryo-https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/directory-of-overseas-posts-for-dissemination.pdf

Tinitiyak ng MWO ang proteksyon ng mga karapatan at nagtataguyod ng kapakanan at interes ng mga manggagawa sa migranteng Pilipino, na tumutulong sa lahat ng mga isyu sa relasyon sa employer.Alalahanin: Ayon sa POEA Standard na kontrata sa pagtatrabaho para sa Pilipinong Serbisyo sa Serbisyo ng Pilipino (HSWS) na nakatali para sa Kaharian ng Saudi Arabia (2013):

"

Inquiries_English: My employer and agency  said that I should pay for my plane ticket. Is this correct?
Sub_Topic_Question: Sabi ng amo ko at agency dito, na dapat ko daw bayaran ang plane ticket ko,tama po ba ito?
Established_Response: According to the POEA Standard Employment Contract for Filipino Household Service Workers (HSWs) Bound for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (2013) there is free transportation to the site of employment and back to the point of origin upon expiration of contract and ensure the worker’s timely repatriation. In case, of termination for reason not attributable to the worker, the employer shall bear the cost of repatriation of the worker to the Philippines.

"

Sub_Topic_Question: Sino ang magbabayad para sa aking airfare kung ako ay terminate?

The proceeds of this benefit go directly to the agency to reimburse the cost of oneway plane ticket back to the Philippines.

Inquiries_English: What does "quit claim" mean?
Sub_Topic_Question: Ano ang ibig sabihin ng quit claim?
Established_Response:
When employees receive their final pay, they are typically asked to sign a release and quitclaim form. This form is a formal agreement indicating that the employee has received all owed compensation and waives any future claims against the employer.
REMEMBER, only sign a quit claim if all unpaid salary and other unsettled money claims have been provided to you by your employer or recruitment agency. Signing the quit claim should be done at the POLO/MWO to ensure that your rights are protected and the process follows proper legal procedures. This also ensures that all claims are appropriately addressed and there will be no issues in the future.
Established_Response_Tagalog:
Kapag natanggap ng mga empleyado ang kanilang pangwakas na suweldo, karaniwang hinihiling silang mag -sign isang paglabas at quitclaim form.Ang form na ito ay isang pormal na kasunduan na nagpapahiwatig na ang empleyado ay nakatanggap ng lahat ng may utang na kabayaran at tinanggihan ang anumang mga paghahabol sa hinaharap laban sa employer.
Tandaan, mag -sign lamang ng isang quit claim kung ang lahat ng hindi bayad na suweldo at iba pang hindi nabigo na mga paghahabol sa pera ay ibinigay sa iyo ng iyong employer o ahensya ng pangangalap.Ang pag -sign sa quit claim ay dapat gawin sa POLO/MWO upang matiyak na protektado ang iyong mga karapatan at ang proseso ay sumusunod sa wastong mga ligal na pamamaraan.Tinitiyak din nito na ang lahat ng mga pag -angkin ay naaangkop na natugunan at walang mga isyu sa hinaharap.

Inquiries_English: What does "SENA" mean?
Sub_Topic_Question: Ano ang ibig sabihin ng SENA?
Established_Response: Civil cases are initially processed through the Single Entry Approach (SEnA) for mandatory conciliation before proceeding to the National Labor Relations Commission (NLRC) or courts. This report focuses on money claims filed by OFWs, such as for unpaid wages and contract violations. These claims, categorized as civil cases, seek compensation for issues like employer abuse, wage non-payment, illegal contract termination, and excessive agency fees. Such claims can be filed in the Philippines against recruitment agencies under joint and solidary liability.
Established_Response_Tagalog: Ang mga kaso ng sibil ay una nang naproseso sa pamamagitan ng solong diskarte sa pagpasok (SENA) para sa ipinag -uutos na pagkakasundo bago magpatuloy sa National Labor Relations Commission (NLRC) o mga korte.Ang ulat na ito ay nakatuon sa mga paghahabol sa pera na isinampa ng mga OFW, tulad ng para sa hindi bayad na sahod at paglabag sa kontrata.Ang mga habol na ito, na ikinategorya bilang mga kaso ng sibil, ay humingi ng kabayaran para sa mga isyu tulad ng pang-aabuso sa employer, hindi bayad na bayad, pagwawakas ng iligal na kontrata, at labis na bayad sa ahensya.Ang nasabing mga pag -aangkin ay maaaring isampa sa Pilipinas laban sa mga ahensya ng recruitment sa ilalim ng magkasanib at solidaryong pananagutan.

Inquiries_English: My agency in the Philippines has already closed, who can I file a complaint with?
Sub_Topic_Question: Sarado na po ang agency ko sa pinas, sino po ang maaaring ireklamo?
Established_Response:

If your recruitment agency has closed and you need to file a complaint related to OFWs, direct it to the Department of Migrant Workers (DMW) in the Philippines. Find the complaints or legal assistance section (https://dmw.gov.ph/archives/AssistWELL/categ/legal.htm). Lastly, follow the instructions to file your complaint, including filling out forms and submitting evidence like contracts, receipts, and communication records.

Kung ang iyong ahensya ng pangangalap ay nagsara at kailangan mong mag -file ng isang reklamo na may kaugnayan sa OFWS, idirekta ito sa Kagawaran ng Migrant Workers (DMW) sa Pilipinas.Hanapin ang seksyon ng mga reklamo o ligal na tulong (https://dmw.gov.ph/archives/assistwell/categ/legal.htm).Panghuli, sundin ang mga tagubilin upang mai -file ang iyong reklamo, kabilang ang pagpuno ng mga form at pagsusumite ng katibayan tulad ng mga kontrata, resibo, at mga tala sa komunikasyon.

Inquiries_English: I have returned to the Philippines, how do I file a complaint against my recruitment agency?
Sub_Topic_Question: Nakauwi na po ako pinas, paano mag-file ng reklamo sa akin recruitment agency?
Established_Response:
To file a complaint against your recruitment agency as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), follow these steps with the Department of Migrant Workers (DMW):
1.        Visit the DMW Website: https://dmw.gov.ph/
2.        Access the Complaints Section: https://dmw.gov.ph/archives/AssistWELL/categ/legal.htm
3.        Gather Documents: Collect your employment contract, receipts, communication records, and other relevant evidence.
4.        Fill Out Forms: Complete the complaint forms on the DMW website, at the DMW office, or at OWWA regional welfare office  - kindly click this link to locate the nearest office the https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-content/uploads/2022/08/RWOs-Directory-as-of-08262022-2.pdf
5.        Submit Your Complaint: Follow the instructions to submit your complaint online or in person with all required documents.
6.        Follow Up: Regularly check the status of your complaint and provide any additional information if requested.

Upang mag -file ng isang reklamo laban sa iyong ahensya ng recruitment bilang isang Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW), sundin ang mga hakbang na ito kasama ang Kagawaran ng Migrant Workers (DMW):
1. Bisitahin ang website ng DMW: https://dmw.gov.ph/
2. I -access ang seksyon ng mga reklamo: https://dmw.gov.ph/archives/assistwell/categ/legal.htm

4. Punan ang Mga Form: Kumpletuhin ang Mga Form ng Reklamo sa website ng DMW, sa tanggapan ng DMW, o sa Owwa Regional Welfare Office - mabait na i -click ang link na ito upang hanapin ang pinakamalapit na tanggapan ng https://owwa.gov.ph/wp-c -content/uploads/2022/08/rwos-directory-as-of-08262022-2.pdf

6. Sundin: Regular na suriin ang katayuan ng iyong reklamo at magbigay ng anumang karagdagang impormasyon kung hiniling.
